medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Both sisters were clinically and biochemically euthyroid when they presented. Following total thyroidectomy, patient A developed deepening of voice and increased facial hair over several weeks, with laboratory evaluation revealing elevated testosterone.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient A developed virilization secondary to unilateral ovarian Sertoli-Leydig cell tumor (SLCT) and an incidental cystic nephroma was also found. Their mother had a history of right hemi-thyroidectomy for a benign thyroid nodule at age 13, completion thyroidectomy for follicular thyroid carcinoma at age 18, left oophorectomy for SLCT at age 7, and a partial right oophorectomy for SLCT at age 18.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal history of differentiated thyroid carcinoma (DTC) and bilateral ovarian SLCT.
